baseline_compressors module

Contains some elementary baseline compressors 1. Fixed bit width compressor

class baseline_compressors.AlphabetDecoder

Bases: core.data_encoder_decoder.DataDecoder

decode the encoded alphabet set

decode_block(params_data_bitarray: utils.bitarray_utils.BitArray)

abstract function to decode one encoded_bitarray

subclassing decoders mainly need to only implement this function.

Parameters

bitarray (BitArray) – input encoded bitarray

Returns

returns the decoded data and how many bits were used the num_bits_consumed can be used appropriately if the encoded bitarray contains encoded bits from more than one encoders

Return type

decoded_block (DataBlock), num_bits_consumed (int)

class baseline_compressors.AlphabetEncoder

Bases: core.data_encoder_decoder.DataEncoder

encode the alphabet set for a block

Technically, the input to the encode_block is a set and not a DataBlock, but we don’t plan on using the “encode” function for this class anyway

encode_block(alphabet)

encode the alphabet set

  • Encodes the size of the alphabet set using 8 bits

  • The ascii value corresponding to each alphabet is then encoded using 8 bits

class baseline_compressors.FixedBitwidthDecoder

Bases: core.data_encoder_decoder.DataDecoder

decode_block(bitarray: utils.bitarray_utils.BitArray)

Decode data encoded by FixedBitwidthDecoder

  • retrieve the alphabet

  • the size of the alphabet implies the bit width used for encoding the symbols

  • decode data

class baseline_compressors.FixedBitwidthEncoder

Bases: core.data_encoder_decoder.DataEncoder

Encode each symbol using a fixed number of bits

encode_block(data_block: core.data_block.DataBlock)

first encode the alphabet and then each data symbol using fixed number of bits

baseline_compressors.test_alphabet_encode_decode()

test the alphabet compression

baseline_compressors.test_fixed_bitwidth_encode_decode()

test the encode_block and decode_block functions of FixedBitWidthEncoder and FixedBitWidthDecoder

baseline_compressors.test_fixed_bitwidth_file_write()
